result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian Francis Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Brian Francis Anderson was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brian Francis Anderson is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Brian Francis Anderson was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Rohan. ADA:   Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Brian Francis Anderson appeared from jail. Case called at 3:12 pm. Court reviews file. ADA Minser gives sentencing argument. Atty. Harrelson responds. DE makes statement. 
Crt orders Count 1:
Imposed Sentence 5 months St. Croix County Jail
105 days credit
Costs $200 DNA sample and surcharge
$243 court costs
both on payment plans (make payments $25/mo beginning 60 days after release , $50/mo 6 months thereafter)
Sentencing hearing at 03-02-2016 03:00 pm

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Liddle.ADA:   Matthew L Hartung   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Brian Francis Anderson appeared from jail. JURY TRIAL. Case called at 8:01 a.m. outside the presence of the jury. Court notes this is the date and time set for a jury trial. 18 jurors will be considered today. Court received the states witness list. Atty Harrelson has no additional witnesses unless his client would choose to testify. ADA Hartung addresses witness list. Requesting to add Sheila K. as a possible witness. No objection by Atty Harrelson. Court will allow Sheila Kingsbury be added to witness list. Both parties filed proposed jury instructions and motions in limine. Court will grant Motion in Limine #1 by Atty Harrelson regarding defendant's dress atire. ADA Hartung does not plan on offering other acts. Atty Harrelson has no objection to testimony. Court regarding statements made by DE at time of arrest will be allowed and statements after arrest will be limited to underlying crime. Court will grant Motion in Limine #3. Sequestration of witnesses. Court will preliminarily grant Motion #4. Motion #5 granted. Motion #7, court reporter will record all testimony and Voir Dire except for Side Bars. Court has a standard Voir Dire. Court will provide written instructions. Motion #10. Obligation of the State. Court will grant. Motion #11. State has obligation. Court will grant. ADA Hartung addresses #11 and #12. Court notes the obligation of the state for #11, #12 and #13. Motion #14. ADA Hartung states that they have done background checks on witnesses. Atty Harrelson makes statement. Court suggests counsel confer over the conviction numbers of the witnesses. Court will address rights of DE if chooses to testify. Admission of evidence will be discussed amongst parties. State's Motion in Limine. Court grants Motion#1. Court grants Motion #2. Motion #3 granted but there are some exceptions. #4 covered. #5 granted. #6 granted. #7 granted in general. Motion #8, parties give argument. Court will note Atty Harrelson's argument. Motion #9, granted in part. Testimony may illicit facts about Conduct. Motion #10, court will reserve. Motion #11 has been addressed. Court will permit jury note taking during evidentiary portions only. Court will permit the jury to ask questions, will be submitted in writing and court will then address. Atty Harrelson will give opening statement up front. Circulate exhibits. Court will empanel 18 jurors. 3 or 4 peremptory strikes depending on number of jurors called. Court addressed Voir Dire. ADA Hartung filed an amended complaint. Atty Harrelson does not have an objection to that amendment in the complaint but would like jury instructions to reflect the amendments. Court will grant amendments to Counts 2 and 3 on the criminal complaint and will entertain Atty Harrelson later regarding jury instructions. Court will adjourn at 8:37 a.m. Case recalled at 8:59 a.m. without jury present. ADA Hartung states issue is resolved regarding the physical evidence but not the ax. As for prior convictions for witnesses, stipulated to 2 convictions. Atty Harrelson in agreement. Court will accept the stipulation and limit inquiry to 2 convictions. Regarding witness C. Nash, arguments given on current status. ADA Hartung gives argument. Court will reserve on that issue at this time. Record reflects that Atty Olson is present for her client C. Nash. Court adjourned at 9:04 a.m. Case recalled at 9:09 a.m. with jurors present. Oath of Jurors as to Qualifications given at 9:10 a.m. Voir Dire by the court at 9:17 a.m. Voir Dire by ADA Hartung at 10:08 a.m. Voir Dire by Atty Harrelson at 10:17 a.m. SIDE BAR. Continued Voir Dire by Atty Harrelson. SIDE BAR. Peremptory strike at 10:34 a.m. OFF THE RECORD. Case recalled at 10:42 a.m.  12 Jurors selected at 10:42 a.m. Oath of Jurors for Trial given at 10:43 a.m. Jury excused at 10:46 a.m. On the record outside the presence of the jury. ADA Hartung makes statement. Atty Harrelson gives argument and does not challenge to the legality of the arrest. Court will grant State's motion. Case called at 11:04 a.m. with the jury present. Jury Instructions given by the court. Opening statement given by ADA Hartung at 11:15 a.m. SIDE BAR. Opening statement by Atty Harrelson at 11:27 a.m. ADA Hartung calls Jeffrey Lehto to the stand. S/T Jeffrey Lehto. Direct by ADA Hartung. Witness identifies defendant in the courtroom. Record will reflect identification. State's Exhibit's #1-#14 (photos). Copies have been provided to Atty Harrelson and the court. O/R Exhibit's #1-#14. State's Exhibit's #15 & #16(photos of Jeffrey Lehto wrists). O/R Exhibit's #15 & #16 and permission to publish exhibits to the jury. State's Exhibit #17 (hatchet). Permission to publish to the jury. O/R Exhibit #17. Case recalled with jury present at 1:15 p.m. Mr. Lehto retakes the stand still under oath. Cross by Atty Harrelson. Redirect by ADA Hartung. Witness released from subpeona at 1:34 p.m. ADA Hartung calls John Nash to the stand. S/T John Nash. Direct by ADA Hartung. Refers to Exhibit's #1-#14. Refers to Exhibit #17. Cross by Atty Harrelson. Redirect by ADA Hartung. Witness identifies defendant in the courtroom. Record will reflect identification. Questions from jurors. Court directs Mr. Nash. Witness excused and released from subpeona. Jury excused at 1:59 p.m. On the record outside the presence of the jury. Addressing the matter of Chris Nash and what he should be dressed in when testified. Both parties give arguments. Court will authorize Mr. Chris Nash to wear civilian clothes and without shackles when testifing. Court adjourns at 2:01 p.m. Case recalled with the jury present at 2:20 p.m. State calls Christopher Nash to the stand. S/T Christopher Nash. Direct by ADA Hartung. Witness identifies defendant in the courtroom. Record reflects identification. Refers to State's Exhibit #17. Cross by Atty Harrelson. SIDE BAR. Redirect by ADA Hartung. Questions from jurors. Court directs witness. Recross by Atty Harrelson. Follow-up by ADA Hartung. Witness excused at 3:02 p.m. Jury excused at 3:03 p.m. Court adjourns at 3:04 p.m. Case recalled and jury present at 3:12 p.m. ADA Hartung calls Deputy Shilts Jr to the stand. S/T John Shilts Jr. Direct by ADA Hartung. Witness identifies defendant in the courtroom. Record reflects identification. Witness reviews Exhibit's #1-#14. Cross by Atty Harrelson. DE Exhibit #18 (booking sheet). O/R Exhibit #18 for purposes of photograph and will reserve on balance. Redirect by ADA Hartung. Questions from the jurors. Court directs witness. Witness excused. Exhibit #18 photograph published to the jurors. ADA Hartung calls Officer Chase Durand. S/T Chase Durand. Direct by ADA Hartung. Witness identifies defendant in the courtroom. Record reflects identification. Witness excused. State would move for admission of Exhibits and rests at this time. Jury excused at 3:49 p.m. Court ajourned at 3:50 p.m. Case recalled at 3:59 p.m. outside the presence of the jury. Atty Harrelson states his client waives his right to testify. Court reviews defendants right to testify and right to remain silent. DE understands and waives right to testify. Atty Harrelson is satisfied that defendant knowingly understands and waives rights. Court will find that defendant is competent and knowingly and voluntarily waives right to testify and accepts defendant's decision. Court will O/R Exhibit #18, the full booking sheet and #18a photograph that was published to the jury. Atty Harrelson makes a Motion to Dismiss. ADA Hartung gives argument. Court at this time will reserve ruling on the motion and let the jury decide. Court reviews jury instructions with the parties. ADA Hartung requests Battery instruction and objects to self defense instruction. Atty Harrelson gives argument. Will be 12 verdict forms. Court will include self defense instruction. Court adjourns at 4:12 p.m. Case recalled at 4:31 p.m. outside the presence of the jury. Court goes over the final jury instructions with parties. Court has also prepared 12 Verdict forms. Case recalled and jury present at 4:41 p.m. Atty Harrelson, defense rests. Jury instructions read by the court at 4:43 p.m. Closing argument by ADA Hartung at 5:09 p.m. Closing argument by Atty Harrelson at 5:28 p.m. Rebuttal by ADA Hartung. Closing instructions by the court at 5:54 p.m. Oath to Bailiff given at 6:00 p.m. Jury out to deliberate at 6:01 p.m. On the record outside the presence of the jury, no objection by either party on jurors viewing the exhibits. If requested, court will bring exhibits to jurors. Court adjourns at 6:05 p.m. Case recalled at 6:54 p.m. outside the presence of the jury. Court received 2 questions from the jurors. Parties agree with the court on the answers to be provided. Pictures asked for. Court will provide Exhibit's #1-#16 and Exhibit #18a. Court adjourned at 6:56 p.m. Case recalled and jury present at 9:13 p.m. Jury has reached a verdict. Verdict's 2,3,5,7,9 and 11 have been returned unsigned. No jury polling requested by either party. Jury excused at 9:17 p.m. Court will enter a judgment of conviction of Ct 1 Resisting an Officer and aquital on Ct.'s 2-6. Court addresses sentencing. ADA Hartung requesting to be scheduled after revocation hearing. Court orders bond to remain. If revocation status changes, court will review bond. Schedule sentencing in the next several weeks.

Ct.1- GUILTY
Ct.2- NOT GUILTY 
Ct.3- NOT GUILTY
Ct.4- NOT GUILTY
Ct.5- NOT GUILTY
Ct.6- NOT GUILTY

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Webb. ADA: Matthew L Hartung, DF: Brian Francis Anderson appeared from jail, pro se.  Court called at 10:38 a.m.  DE appears pro se from jail.  Court questions the DE regarding representation.  DE is eligible for public defender representation.  Court will call the public defenders office to confirm the representation.  Court will have the Judicial Assistant's office schedule the hearing once confirming representation.  Court adjourned at 10:42 a.m.
Pre-trial conference at 12-04-2015 10:30 am

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Jeffrey L., Christopher N., John N. or Rebecca L.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
Defendant appeared via video conferencing from the St Croix County jail.

CO: SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA: Matthew L Hartung,  DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton,  DF:  Brian Francis Anderson appeared from jail via video. Court confirms address. Defendant refused counsel, he will obtain Atty Harrelson. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  Court enters NG.  Demand speedy trial. JA to contact Atty Harrelson to set up date (Mon, Tue or Wed of next week).
Defendant appeared via video conferencing from the St Croix County jail.

CO: CAR for SRN, RPT: Kasten, Clerk: E. Ferrill, ADA Matthew Hartung, Atty Joseph Caton and Brian F. Anderson appears from jail via video. Defendant is on a PO hold. Court finds probable cause and holds him over without bail.
